body.p:
To his excellency B Maggoffin
Governor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Philip Gormley respectfully shews to ^your^ exellency that he has recently been convicted in the Fayette Circuit Court of the offence of selling spiritious liquors by retail the prosecution is it being a shut case legally termed Keeping a tipling house the proscaution being malicious & spitefull Your petitioner in extenuation says to your excellency that he is poor and that he has an insane wife and suckling child this child only 6 months of age on which account he cannot leave his house to go about any employment or labour. They requiring his contstant attention if -- Your peitioner is sent to prison and he has not money to pay the fine, his wife will have to be sent to the insane asylum and his child to the poor house a charge to the State at present he supports them by his own exertions he therefore hopes Your excellency will remit his fine & the undersigned concur in the object of this petition.

John McCoy
We unite in this petition
Dandnes & J B Payne
D. Mulligan
A. H. Robertson
B. H Allen
James B Beck
Frank. Waters
Geo. D Wharter
B B Parker city Clerk
W H Murphy City Marshal
C D Carr Prss Judge Fay. Co
B F Graves
J B Norton clk Fay Co Ct
R. Marsh, Member City Council
D. F. Wolf do " do
C. T. Worley Mayor Lexington

Remitted
B. M.
Fayette Cir. Ct
$60. } Tipling
P. Gormley
Issd Feby 27. 1862
